docs.lead_paragraph: Varicose veins, a potentially troublesome medical problem, afflict millions of Americans. One of mankind's earliest recorded ailments - varicosis is mentioned in the world's first medical book, an Egyptian papyrus from 1500 B.C. - its causes remain enigmatic to modern medicine. Most distressing is the unsightly appearance of varicose veins. Bulging and inky-blue, just beneath the surface of the skin, they snake the legs like twisted ropes.
